description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/3173494494 at Fri Oct 14 10:28:11 UTC 2022

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: camoproxy Service Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="camoproxy"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="camoproxy"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="camoproxy"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="camoproxy"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="camoproxy"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="camoproxy"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="camoproxy"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="camoproxy"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="camoproxy"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="camoproxy"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="camoproxy"})),

    "period", "30m", "", ""

)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

panels.content:
### Observability Tools

* [Google Load Balancer](https://console.cloud.google.com/net-services/loadbalancing/details/http/k8s2-um-8kvupfyn-camoproxy-camoproxy-6ygs428t?project=gitlab-production)
* [Stackdriver Logs: Loadbalancer Access Logs](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=resource%2Elabels%2Eurl%5Fmap%5Fname%3D%22k8s2%2Dum%2D8kvupfyn%2Dcamoproxy%2Dcamoproxy%2D6ygs428t%22%0Aresource%2Etype%3D%22http%5Fload%5Fbalancer%22;timeRange=PT30M?project=gitlab-production)
* [Stackdriver Logs: Loadbalancer Access 5xx Logs](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=httpRequest%2Estatus%3E%3D500%0Aresource%2Elabels%2Eurl%5Fmap%5Fname%3D%22k8s2%2Dum%2D8kvupfyn%2Dcamoproxy%2Dcamoproxy%2D6ygs428t%22%0Aresource%2Etype%3D%22http%5Fload%5Fbalancer%22;timeRange=PT30M?project=gitlab-production)

sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="server",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="camoproxy"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""

  or

    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_5m{component="server",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="camoproxy"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="server",monitor="global",type="camoproxy"})))),

panels.title: server SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

This SLI monitors the camoproxy server via its HTTP interface.
5xx responses are considered to be failures. Note that this SLI
is highly dependent on upstream proxy targets, not under the control
of GitLab. We are unable to distinguish problems in the proxy from
upstream problems. This should be taken into account for this SLI.



### Observability Tools

* [üìñ Kibana: Camoproxy logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.hostname,json.camoproxy_message,json.camoproxy_err),filters:!((meta:(key:json.type,params:camoproxy,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:camoproxy,type:phrase))))),index:'AWz5hIoSGphUgZwzAG7q')&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìñ Kibana: Camoproxy failed request logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.hostname,json.camoproxy_message,json.camoproxy_err),filters:!((meta:(key:json.type,params:camoproxy,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:camoproxy,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:exists,type:json.camoproxy_err,value:exists),query:(exists:(field:json.camoproxy_err)))),index:'AWz5hIoSGphUgZwzAG7q')&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìà Kibana: Camoproxy requests](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AWz5hIoSGphUgZwzAG7q&_a=(filters:!((meta:(key:json.type,params:camoproxy,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:camoproxy,type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(),schema:metric,type:count),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:'@timestamp',interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìà Kibana: Camoproxy failed requests](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AWz5hIoSGphUgZwzAG7q&_a=(filters:!((meta:(key:json.type,params:camoproxy,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:camoproxy,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:exists,type:json.camoproxy_err,value:exists),query:(exists:(field:json.camoproxy_err)))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(),schema:metric,type:count),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:'@timestamp',interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
panels.title: Details
Estimated p95 server Latency - per fqdn
Apdex attribution for server Latency - per fqdn

panels.description:
Kubernetes containers are allocated a share of CPU. When this is exhausted, the container may be thottled.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
        rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="camoproxy"}[5m])
      )
      /
      sum by(environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
        container_spec_cpu_quota:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="camoproxy"}
        /
        container_spec_cpu_period:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="camoproxy"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_cpu component saturation: Kube Container CPU Utilization

panels.description:
Records the total memory utilization for containers for this service, as a percentage of
the memory limit as configured through Kubernetes.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      container_memory_working_set_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="camoproxy"}
      /
      (container_spec_memory_limit_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="camoproxy"} > 0)
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_memory component saturation: Kube Container Memory Utilization

panels.description:
The [Horizontal Pod Autoscaler](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/run-application/horizontal-pod-autoscale/)
automatically scales the number of Pods in a deployment based on metrics.

The Horizontal Pod Autoscaler has a configured upper maximum. When this
limit is reached, the HPA will not increase the number of pods and other
resource saturation (eg, CPU, memory) may occur.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, horizontalpodautoscaler, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_status_desired_replicas:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="camoproxy", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|imports|urgent-authorized-projects|urgent-other"}
      /
      kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_spec_max_replicas:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="camoproxy", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|imports|urgent-authorized-projects|urgent-other"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_desired_replicas component saturation: Horizontal Pod Autoscaler Desired Replicas

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor utilization per instance
